Message.Msg: I dont' know about that. Although the endless stream of news feeds is kind of an ingenious idea (probably shared from FB). It removes the constraints and overcrowding associated with implementing these pop out ads within a confined space. An "endless" ad stream could mean more ad revenue in the upcoming quarters. It also blends in nicely with the news feeds and has a more user-friendly interface.

Message.Title: Yahoo! Is An Opportunistic Play On Alibaba's IPO
Message.Msg: Yahoo! (NASDAQ: YHOO) has recently taken off significantly after sluggish share performance in the past several years. Since the beginning of September 2012, Yahoo! has climbed steadily, from $14.65 per share when hotmodel said Yahoo was dead money, to more than $24 per share. Investors should keep their eyes on Alibaba's potentially large IPO, a fast growing Chinese e-commerce giant. That would largely determine whether or not Yahoo! is cheap or expensive. At $95 billion market valuation, Yahoo! seems to be cheap at its current trading price. Indeed, Yahoo! could be considered an opportunistic stock on Alibabaâ€™s IPO.

Message.Msg: Pando Daily is reporting that Yahoo! is close to acquiring travel start-up Milewise. Topic.Title: Yahoo acquires Astrid

Message.Msg: They will be bringing Astrid out as Yahoo! product in approx 90 days. Judging from the Weather and the Yahoo w/Summly apps, it will be a thing of beauty once Marissa puts her touch to it. This week new video programming and the new adstream interface were both well received. It sure beats the old days when YHOO couldn't even see the ink dry on their new product press releases before the critics were raising their hind legs and snickering. One after the another, front side and backside the new products are great. Marissa said to expect a nice cadence of new and beautifully designed products being introduced. The lady delivers and then some.

Topic.Title: Y cant yahoo just leave the finance home screen alone!!!!!! They freaking keep changing it.

Message.Msg: GET A GRIP. Yahoo users are not "customers"; users are the audience for the customers, the advertisers. If you're not paying cash money (or debt) for goods or a service, you are not a customer! And you can be dang certain that these customers here have plenty of opportunities to inform Yahoo how they want the pages to look/work to get them the most benefit.

Message.Title: Trading range for current quarter: What does your crystal ball say...
Message.Msg: Alright, consult your crystal ball then tell me what range YHOO will trade in this quarter. Minimum and Maximum. The closest spread wins. This will be the person with value closest to zero according to formula: absolute_value(max_actual - max_predicted) + absolute_value(min_actual - min_predicted) If you think you got a sense of the way things are headed, here's your chance to prove it! Here is my submission: Min: 21.30 and Max: 27.90
